ygData.subject: Re: Having problems with 39 charm song
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, since the pause value is in tenths of a second (ie. that s why you have to pause 30 for a 3 second cast/sing time), it s really not that much added
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, since the pause value is in tenths of a second (ie. that's why you
have to pause 30 for a 3 second cast/sing time), it's really not that much
added time.

Olgwinn Pendragun
Bard of 47 Missed Notes
Crimson Legacy
E'ci


> Date: Wed, 8 Nov 2000 11:04:15 -0600
> From: <rkroads@...>
>Subject: Re: Having problems with 39 charm song
>
>Thanks Olgwinn :), I suspected timing was the issue.
>
>My question then is, if so much pause needs to be added to the macros to
>make them work, is it actualy faster to use the separate commands?
>
>When I thought of adding pauses into my attack macro, I thought well, it
>seems faster to have the separate attack key.
>
>I know there is the advantage of fewer keys to mash, but in a situation
>where a mob is beating on you or your party member, speed is of the
>essence.
>
>Maravana Vireo
>56 Bard of Deadly Virtues
>Mithaniel Marr
